description: LONDON  The British police are investigating threatening packages received this week by Muslim members of Parliament that contained a letter calling for Punish a Muslim Day and, in some cases, a noxious substance.

title: Listen to Still Processing
description: We discuss Three Billboards Outside of Ebbing, Missouri and a new sense of placelessness in film and TV.

title: Still Processing: We Dont Know Where We Are
description: This week, we take the Oscar-nominated film Three Billboards Outside of Ebbing, Missouri as a starting point for a discussion about a new sense of placelessness in film and on TV. Over the last year, weve been seeing stories set in ambiguous spaces  the limbo between heaven and hell, distorted models of our world, towns that look like no place we recognize as American. We talk about The Good Place, Westworld, Downsizing and the Sunken Place from Get Out to try to figure out how we lost a sense of where we are. Then we look to shows like Atlanta and The Chi to think about how we might find our way back.

title: How Training for the Paralympics Became a Full-Time Job
description: PYEONGCHANG, South Korea  The delegations ruling the medal table at the Paralympics share a common trait: During the past decade they decided to invest the resources necessary to afford their athletes the same respect, coaching, equipment and opportunities that able-bodied athletes receive.

title: A Cultural Compendium of Whats New
description: The new capsule collection from Loewes Jonathan Anderson was born from the same sense of wonder with which the designer once marveled over his grandmothers hand-knit quilts. For nearly a year, he and his team searched the globe for the best artisans working with fabric, from manjak weavers in southern Senegal to ribbon embroiderers in New Delhi, eventually partnering with over 100 ateliers to create 50 made-to-order tapestries (plus 12 matching tote bags), which will debut at Salone del Mobile in Milan next month.

title: A Former Spy Is Poisoned
description: Prime Minister Theresa May said that it was highly likely that Russia was to blame for the poisoning of a former Russian spy in southern England.

title: Arizonas N.C.A.A. Loss Caps Miserable Year for Pac-12
description: Sometimes conferences have Golden Ages. Think of the Big East's three Final Four teams in 1985. Or the SECs clobbering everyone in recent years in college football.

title: The Bobby Kennedy Pathway
description: After the 2016 election, many progressives were furious to learn that 22 percent of the working-class whites who once supported President Barack Obama voted for Donald Trump. How could the same people back two political figures with such diametrically opposed approaches, particularly on the defining issue of race?

title: In Search of the Perfect Hair Dye
description: From crushed leeches soaked in vinegar to modern chemical compounds, fashionable humans have sought ways to dye their hair for thousands of years.

title: Hijab Removal Lawsuit
description: A class-action suit filed March 16, 2018, challenges the New York Police Department's policy of removing women's hijabs for arrest photos.

title: Does Blended Scotch Still Have a Place in the Modern Bar?
description: My parents did not drink much, but they maintained a full liquor cabinet, either out of a sense of hospitality or because they received a lot of nice gifts.

title: Last Days of Winter
description: Benefits were held for New Jewish Home, Art Production Fund, Adapt Community Network and Bailey House.

title: Is Your Plane About to Crash? Write a Farewell Note and Eat It
description: PICTURE THIS: Scrolling through Pinterest one day, Tomi Adeyemi saw something that would change her life: a digital illustration of a black girl with bright green hair. The image, which burrowed into her subconscious, was so stunning and magical that it inspired her to begin an epic fantasy trilogy that draws equally from current events and African culture. The first volume, Children of Blood and Bone, which enters the Young Adult list at No. 1, is an epic West African adventure, Adeyemi explains, but layered within each page is an allegory for the modern black experience. Every obstacle my characters face, no matter how big or small, is tied to an obstacle black people are fighting today or have fought as recently as 30 years ago.

title: Offshore Drilling: Have the Lessons Been Learned?
description: To the Editor:

title: What Is Porn?
description: To the Editor:

title: Teachers and Annuities: A Questionable Match and Hard Products to Shed
description: NEW ORLEANS  In the world of workplace retirement plans, there is a persistent problem with 403(b)s, which are like 401(k)s but for nonprofit employees.

title: No Lulus for You: Comptroller Threatens to Withhold Lawmakers Payments
description: ALBANY  The state comptrollers office has threatened to reject future requests for lucrative stipend payments worth tens of thousands of dollars from the Republican-led State Senate as a result of its continued use of false committee titles to draw down payments for senators who are part of its ruling coalition.

title: Melanias Gilded Cage
description: To the Editor:

title: Ashlee Simpson: You Asked, We Answered
description: Part two of our conversation about the mid-2000s pop star features debates about her MTV reality show and S.N.L. debacle, and a listener mailbag.

title: Ashlee Simpson: You Asked, We Answered
description: The Popcast is hosted by Jon Caramanica, a pop music critic for The New York Times. It covers the latest in pop music criticism, trends and news.

title: Impeachment, Then and Now
description: Cass R. Sunstein talks about Impeachment: A Citizens Guide and Can It Happen Here?; and Kathryn Hughes discusses Victorians Undone.

title: Impeachment, Then and Now
description: Subscribe: iTunes | Google Play Music

title: Paperback Row
description: Six new paperbacks to check out this week.

title: Colleagues Think Youre Contagious. Youre Sure Youre Not.
description: Send your workplace conundrums to workologist@nytimes.com, including your name and contact information (even if you want it withheld). The Workologist is a guy with well-intentioned opinions, not a professional career adviser. Letters may be edited.

title: Assaults Increased When Cities Hosted Trump Rallies, Study Finds
description: A study published on Friday appears to confirm what news reports suggested long ago: President Trumps campaign rallies were associated with a rise in violence when they came to town.

title: Most Americans Produce Services, Not Stuff. Trump Ignores That in Talking About Trade.
description: You probably work in the service sector. This seems like a safe assertion, as 84 percent of private-sector jobs in the United States are in services.

title: Louise Slaughter, 88, Liberal Congresswoman in 16th Term, Is Dead
description: Louise M. Slaughter, a liberal Democrat who represented an upstate New York district in Congress for more than three decades, pushing to protect health privacy and abortion rights and playing a key role in the passage of President Barack Obamas health care overhaul, died on Friday in Washington. She was 88 and in the midst of her 16th term in the House.

title: Stop Apologizing for Being Elite
description: A framed eighth-grade diploma, dated June 19, 1913, hangs on the wall opposite my computer. It belonged to my grandmother, Minnie Rothenhoefer, one of eight children in a German immigrant family, who was forced to quit school at age 14 after her alcoholic father abandoned his family. Her first job was picking onions and her greatest regret  she lived to age 99  was that she never attended high school. But theres no excuse for ignorance when you can go right down to the public library, she often said.

title: 2005: When Two Guys Splitting a Bottle of Wine Became a Man Date
description: Original headline: The Man Date, from April 2005

title: Lemon Roasted Potatoes, Readers Digest, Cat Breaks: Coping Strategies for News-Related Stress
description: The Reader Center is one way we in the newsroom are trying to connect with you, by highlighting your perspectives and experiences and offering insight into how we work.

title: Yes, Adults Can Have Chocolate for Breakfast. Really.
description: No matter how much cream and honey you pour into your bowl, no matter the raisins or raspberries that dot the top, there will always be something gray and Dickensian about a bowl of morning porridge.

title: An Invisible Artwork Reminds Austria of Its Nazi Past
description: VIENNA  Four haunting musical notes have enveloped central Viennas Heldenplatz, or Heroes Square. An invisible artworks voice-like sounds swirl down from a former Hapsburg palace, and float across from two buildings on the other side of the huge public space.

title: Gary Burden, Designer of Famous Album Covers, Dies at 84
description: Gary Burden, who beginning in the late 1960s designed memorable album covers for Neil Young, Joni Mitchell, the Doors and numerous other stars of rock and folk-rock, died on March 7 in Los Angeles. He was 84.

title: Wed Like to Know: Where Would You Go in Wakanda?
description: In the film Black Panther, the mythical African nation of Wakanda, known to outsiders as a small and mostly agrarian country, is protected by a holographic camouflage, which shields its advanced society from the rest of the world. Among the many great things about the film is its emphasis on Wakandas technological gems, along with showcasing the landscape of the modern country. However, to the casual filmgoer, there is a lot that can be left to the imagination.

title: Rewilding Missing Carnivores May Help Restore Some Landscapes
description: If youre lucky, you can spot a gray wolf in Yellowstone National Park. But a century ago, youd have been hard pressed to find any there. Poisonings and unregulated hunting obliterated nearly all of these majestic canines from Canada to Mexico, their original home range.

title: Remember Rex Tillerson? The Secretary of States Changing Role
description: President Trump fired his secretary of state, Rex W. Tillerson, with a tweet this week.

title: When Surfing Rockaway, Its Watch Out or Wipeout
description: One morning  a few weeks after the so-called bomb cyclone in January had thrown record-low temperatures, high winds and thick ocean waves onto Rockaway Beach in Queens  the conditions remained gnarly. It was 35 degrees, snowing, the Atlantic Ocean was colder than normal at 38 degrees, and the winds were whipping.

title: Rabbi Mordechai Hager, Leader of Large Hasidic Sect, Dies at 95
description: Rabbi Mordechai Hager, the reserved but strong-willed leader of one of the nations largest Hasidic sects, who settled many of his followers in a relatively bucolic upstate enclave to escape New York Citys temptations and decadence, died on Friday in Manhattan. He was 95.

title: How the Irish Could Still Save Civilization
description: The White House opened its doors to the leader of the original shithole country this week. The irony was that a president who wants only the smartest and best-looking immigrants was embracing a nation once known for sending famine-stricken, disease-laden, crime-breeding foreigners to our shores.

title: The Rise and Fall of Elizabeth Holmes and the Black Turtleneck
description: The long, slow slide into ignominy of Theranos, the Silicon Valley company that was once the poster brand for biotech breakthroughs, and its founder, Elizabeth Holmes, came to a seeming end this week with the announcement of the S.E.C.s charge of widespread fraud, and an agreement to settle.

title: How Good Is That Womens Player? Look a Little Deeper
description: Soon after Alex Varlan was hired as the video coordinator for the University of Tennessee womens basketball team last summer, he called Aaron Barzilai, a friend and former colleague with the Philadelphia 76ers.

title: The Mueller Inquiry: Follow the Money
description: To the Editor:

title: A Conversation With Louise Penny: The Canada Letter
description: Hi! This is Dan Bilefsky, giving Ian Austen a couple of weeks off from this newsletter as I go on my road trip aimed at rediscovering Quebec, my home province, after an absence of 28 years.

title: How to Invest With a Conscience (and Still Make Money)
description: Jean Case, the chief executive of the Case Foundation, is a leader in impact investing, a movement that aims to force social change by minimizing or eliminating investors exposure to companies that harm the world and achieve a solid return.

title: About 3 in 4 Teachers Oppose Arming School Staff, Survey Finds
description: Nearly three out of four teachers oppose letting staff members carry guns in schools, according to a new poll that shows little support for a proposal that has become central to President Trumps response to the school shooting last month in Parkland, Fla.

title: After Social Media Outcry, French Museum Removes Video of Burning Chickens
description: A video work by the Algerian artist Adel Abdessemed that showed chickens ablaze and hanging by their feet was removed from an exhibition in France after it drew criticism on social media.

title: Despite Speculation, Trumps Cabinet Remains Intact
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump made no immediate moves on Friday to dismiss members of his administration, despite continuing reports of an impending shake-up that have unsettled the White House.

title: Mr. Levines Lawsuit Against the Met
description: He sued the company for breach of contract and defamation on Thursday, three days after it fired him when an investigation found he had engaged in sexually abusive and harassing conduct.

title: Astronauts Mark and Scott Kelly Are Still Identical Twins, Despite What You May Have Read
description: Some of this weeks headlines, it turns out, vastly oversold what might happen to your genes when you spend almost a year in space.

title: Trump Was Elected to Govern Without These People
description: In Washington, personnel is policy. As President Trump reshuffles his cabinet and White House advisers, that truism has critics worried.

title: The Playlist: Pearl Jam Kicks Up a Fury, and 9 More New Songs
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos  and anything else that strikes them as intriguing. This week, a protest song from Willie Nelson, a few unwise words from Chris Brown and a St. Patricks Day surprise from the Gloaming.

title: Fight to Control Office That Roots Out Corruption in New York Schools
description: The selection of a new chancellor has dominated education circles in New York City for the last few weeks, but behind the scenes a more prosaic bureaucratic drama was playing out over control of the office that investigates corruption in the 1.1 million-student school system.

title: Review: As James Levine Sues, the Met Opera Opens a New Cos
description: The last time the Metropolitan Opera put on Mozarts Cos Fan Tutte, in the 2013-14 season, it was to celebrate the return to the podium of its music director, James Levine. He had missed the previous two seasons because of health problems, so it felt like a moving triumph for him to come back with this, an opera that was long one of his specialties.

title: Make T Something | Misha Kahn
description: The Duluth, Minn.-born, Brooklyn-based artist cultivates detritus with a vengeance  and his seven-foot-long cast-bronze console is featured in Ts March 25 Design issue. Here, Kahn tries to stay cool under pressure while creating an artwork in less than one hour.

title: How About an Armani for Your Aria?
description: In a sunlit studio space at the Juilliard School, the prestigious arts institution at Lincoln Center in Manhattan, Marie Engle emerged from a makeshift mirrored dressing room on Wednesday in a to-the-floor fuchsia jersey gown with a plunging neckline.

title: Review: On Netflix, a Wild Story of Guns, Sex and a Guru
description: Jane Stork and Ma Anand Sheela, onscreen throughout the six-hour documentary series Wild Wild Country on Netflix, look and sound like friends of your grandmother who have dropped by to reminisce about the good old days.

title: Review: An American in London (Bernstein, That Is)
description: LONDON  The last time Wayne McGregor and Christopher Wheeldon had premieres on the same program was in 2006, at the Royal Ballet. The minimalist, sculptural Chroma, by Mr. McGregor, was a smash hit, and led to his appointment as the Royals resident choreographer, a title he still holds. DGV, an exhilarating ensemble work by Mr. Wheeldon, was perhaps less surprising in its impact, but also a resounding success.

title: Bouncy Noodles, Bright Greens, Quick Broth: A Perfect Bowl
description: At the top of my list of satisfying meals that nurture body and soul is a big, steaming bowl of noodles in broth.

title: Canada Struggles as It Opens Its Arms to Victims of ISIS
description: CALGARY, Alberta  As leader of one of Canadas largest refugee agencies, Fariborz Birjandian, a refugee himself, has years of experience welcoming the worlds most vulnerable  Kosovar Albanians fleeing ethnic cleansing, Burmese Karens evicted from Thai refugee camps and Syrians escaping the civil war.

title: A Pilot Who Has Broken 2 Glass Ceilings
description: Stephanie Johnson, 49, is a captain at Delta Air Lines.

title: Karlie Kloss Teaches Teenage Girls How to Code
description: Earlier this month, Karlie Kloss invited four teenage girls to her homey office on Lafayette Street in SoHo, where she runs Klossy, a fashion, multimedia and philanthropic organization.

title: Review: At Washington Ballet, 3 Affable, Immature Premieres
description: WASHINGTON  Many in the ballet world remain in shock about American Ballet Theaters Dec. 21 announcement that the star dancer Marcelo Gomes had resigned after an allegation of sexual misconduct. Mr. Gomes, who had recently celebrated 20 years with the company, had a long record with Ballet Theater as an exemplary stylist across a wide repertory, was a superb partner to many ballerinas and held a strong aura of  and reputation for  charm, integrity and commitment.

title: Why Gun Culture Is So Strong in Rural America
description: KNOXVILLE, Iowa  As Democrats have fled rural America  or rural America has fled Democrats  many of them, living in cities, are left without an understanding of rural culture and its core values. If it isnt on abortion, our deepest cultural divide might be on guns. The guns issue also has a profound political dimension, reliably driving rural Americans into Republican arms.

title: How Do Squirrels Jump So High?
Post Troubles, Anti-British Banner Still Flies in St. Patricks Parade
description: The St. Patricks Day Parade in New York City has long been steeped in politics and controversy, but parade organizers have strictly forbidden any signs or banners reflecting political views or slogans  except for one.

title: The Mets Statement
description: The company, in a statement from its lawyer, refuted the main claims of Mr. Levines lawsuit.

title: Qualcomm Needs a Mediator More Than a Buyer
description: Call it cheeky, sentimental or delusional, but Paul Jacobss idea of making an offer for Qualcomm, the company he chaired until this month, is certainly daring. The chip maker only just wiggled out from under a takeover offer from rival Broadcom. What Qualcomm really needs is less a buyer and more a mediator.

title: Dukes Basketball Managers Strive to Be (What Else?) Elite
description: PITTSBURGH  Back and to the left. Back and to the left.

title: Qualcomms Ex-Chairman to Leave Amid Plans to Buy Company
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Qualcomm was co-founded in 1985 by Irwin Jacobs, who took the company public and made it a mobile chips behemoth. He later passed the baton to his son Paul.

title: Fatal Collapse: A Look at How the Florida Bridge Was Built
description: Here are the steps taken to build the bridge at Florida International University that collapsed on Thursday, killing at least six people.

title: Trump, the Television President, Expands His Cast
description: The consternation came swiftly: How could the president pick a newsman  a television reporter, no less  for a government role of serious power and influence?

title: Cos at the Met: The Weeks Best Classical Music Moments on YouTube
description: Our critics and reporters offer a glimpse of whats moved and delighted them on YouTube. Read the rest of our classical music coverage here.

title: F.A.A. Halts Doors-Off Helicopter Flights After New York Crash
description: In the wake of the crash that killed five people in New York City, federal regulators on Friday afternoon ordered an immediate stop to all doors-off helicopter flights that attach passengers to the cabin with harnesses that cannot be removed quickly in an emergency.

title: Anthony Acevedo, Who Documented His Holocaust Ordeal, Dies at 93
description: Anthony Acevedo, a 20-year-old Army medic, had been captured during the Battle of the Bulge when a Red Cross care package arrived in March 1945 at the Nazi slave labor camp where he was imprisoned.

title: Back to the Health Policy Drawing Board
description: The Affordable Care Act needs help. After scores of failed repeal attempts, Congress enacted legislation late last year that eliminated one of the laws central features, the mandate requiring people to buy insurance.

title: Wilson Harris, Guyanese Writer of Intricate Novels, Dies at 96
description: Wilson Harris, a Guyanese novelist and essayist who addressed themes of colonialism and cultural identity in weaving stories of history, fantasy, myth and philosophy, died on March 8 in Chelmsford, England. He was 96.

title: How Trump Has Split With His Administration on Russian Meddling
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has long avoided blaming  or even naming  Russia for meddling in the 2016 election that put him in office.

title: DeAndre Harris, Beaten by White Supremacists in Charlottesville, Is Found Not Guilty of Assault
description: DeAndre Harris, a black man who was brutally beaten at a white supremacist rally in Charlottesville, Va., last year, was acquitted of assault related to an incident that took place moments before he was attacked.

title: Copy Edit This! Quiz No. 11
description: The Timess standards editor, Philip B. Corbett, invites readers to correct grammatical errors in recent New York Times articles.

title: Jersey City Teachers Go on Strike Over Health Insurance
description: Teachers in Jersey City went on strike Friday after they and the school district failed to reach an agreement over the cost of health insurance.

title: What Were Reading
description: What Were Reading wants to thank you for embracing our collection of recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors. As of Monday, we are becoming a feature of the Morning Briefing. You can browse the briefings here, and subscribe here (its free), to find the best The Times and the web have to offer.

title: Open Thread: This Week in Style News
description: Each week, the Open Thread newsletter will offer a look from across The New York Times at the forces that shape the dress codes we share, with Vanessa Friedman as your personal shopper. The latest newsletter appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: James Levine Is a Conductor, Not a God: Readers React to His Firing
description: The Metropolitan Opera fired its longtime conductor James Levine on Monday after an investigation revealed credible evidence that Mr. Levine had engaged in sexually abusive and harassing conduct. The news article prompted more than 600 comments from readers.

title: Kate Wilhelm, Prolific Science Fiction Writer, Dies at 89
description: Kate Wilhelm, a prolific, prizewinning author of science fiction and mystery novels, died on March 8 in Eugene, Ore. She was 89.

title: Emily Nasrallah, Lebanese Novelist and Activist, Dies at 86
description: Emily Nasrallah, a prizewinning Lebanese writer whose novels struggled with bigotry against women, the horrors of civil war and the vacuum left by fleeing refugees, died on Tuesday in Beirut. She was 86.

title: David Wyman, Scholar of Americas Holocaust Response, Dies at 89
description: David S. Wyman, who in a forceful, exhaustively documented 1984 book argued that the United States willfully failed to act to save Jews from the Holocaust, died on Wednesday at his home in Amherst, Mass. He was 89.

title: Second Top Nike Executive Departs Amid Complaints of Workplace Behavior
description: Nike confirmed the departure of a second senior executive within 24 hours on Friday, an apparent shake-up after the global sportswear giant acknowledged it had received internal complaints about workplace behavior.

title: Soccers Top Clubs and Leagues Push Back Against FIFA President
description: BOGOT, Colombia  Groups representing the worlds top soccer leagues and clubs are pushing back against FIFA President Gianni Infantino over plans to introduce new competitions, accusing him of ignoring some of the games biggest stakeholders to push through major changes without proper consultation.

title: Miami, Louise Slaughter, Putin: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: 5 Doctors Are Charged With Taking Kickbacks for Fentanyl Prescriptions
description: In March of 2013, Gordon Freedman, a doctor on Manhattans Upper East Side, fielded a request from a regional sales manager for the manufacturer of Subsys, a spray form of the highly addictive painkiller fentanyl.

title: Readers React to Misconduct Accusations Against Richard Meier
description: Five women accused the architect Richard Meier of sexual harassment. Mr. Meier designed the Getty Center in Los Angeles and won the Pritzker Prize, architectures highest honor, in 1984, making him the youngest winner of that award.

title: With a Nevada Senate Candidates Exit, the Bannon Revolt Fizzles
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump persuaded a conservative businessman in Nevada to drop his primary challenge to a sitting Republican senator on Friday, effectively ending a populist revolt that Stephen K. Bannon once promised would scorch establishment Republican senators from coast to coast this year.

title: Palliative Care Film Challenges Stereotypes About Opioids
description: Hippocratic, a documentary about the life of Dr. M.R. Rajagopal, Indias leading advocate of palliative care, is now touring the United States  a country where attitudes toward pain relief have changed because of the overdose epidemic.

title: Irish-Born Boxer Hopes to Be a St. Patricks Day Staple in New York
description: If you are in New York City and of Irish descent, there is probably little question where you will be on March 17 of any given year: parading down Fifth Avenue with the occasional stop at a pub for a pint of Guinness or a spot of Jamesons.

title: Two by Design
description: Naina Shah and Abhishek Honawar are at the forefront of an Indian creative class.

title: The Creative Couple Bridging the Worlds of Hospitality and Embroidery
description: Outside Naina Shah and Abhishek Honawars Manhattan apartment, the sky is the color of raw concrete. But inside the couples airy East Village apartment, which smells faintly of Assam tea and glints with eye-catching Indian regional crafts  miniature caskets inlaid with mother-of-pearl, hand-woven kauna grass baskets, carved wooden spirit masks collected on their travels through Rajasthan, Kerala and Goa  everything sparkles with light.

title: Trumps Tariffs Set Off Storm of Lobbying
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps decision to impose tariffs on imported steel and aluminum has prompted a stampede by foreign countries and companies and their American partners pressing for exemptions and exclusions that could be worth billions of dollars in trade.

title: Nokie Edwards, Whose Guitar Drove the Ventures, Dies at Is Dead at 82
description: Nokie Edwards, whose virtuosic electric guitar playing helped define the surf-rock style of the Ventures, the immensely popular instrumental band that rose to prominence in the 1960s, died on March 12 in Yuma, Ariz. He was 82.

title: San Antonio Spurs Face an Unfamiliar Opponent Down the Stretch: Discontent
description: The warning is taken so seriously by members of the N.B.A.s press corps that it should be sprinkled in with the rest of the fine print on the back of every media credential, alongside the stock reminders that transmitting live game action without proper consent or seeking autographs from players is forbidden:

title: Clint Frazier Is Part of Baseballs Evolution on Concussions
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Two weeks after he twice crashed into an outfield wall, Clint Frazier could not keep the names of his cats  Papi and Phoenix  straight. He gave up driving to work at times because his depth perception was off. And when he swung a bat, his head became muddled.

title: Quotation of the Day: Germans First? Food Bank Bars Migrants, Setting Off Storm
description: We have worked and paid taxes in this country; our parents built it up. How can it be that we are turned away and those who just arrived get what they need?

title: Spies, Not Diplomats, Take Lead Role in Planning Trumps North Korea Meeting
description: WASHINGTON  The Central Intelligence Agency has emerged as the primary player in President Trumps audacious diplomatic opening to North Korea, several officials said on Friday, conducting back-channel communications and taking a major role in planning Mr. Trumps coming meeting with Kim Jong-un, the countrys ruler.

title: James Levine, a Fractured Partnership and a Met Opera Lawsuit
description: Seven years ago, when the conductor James Levine marked his 40th anniversary with the Metropolitan Opera, Peter Gelb, the companys general manager, went all out to celebrate him.

title: 2 New York City Firefighters Killed in Iraq Helicopter Crash
description: A day after a United States military helicopter crashed during a troop transport mission in western Iraq, the grim news traveled nearly 6,000 miles west, back to New York: Two city firefighters were among the service members killed.

title: Nanny Told Psychiatrist She Had No Memory of Killing Two Children
description: Eleven days after Yoselyn Ortega killed two children in her care with a kitchen knife, she told a psychiatrist she could not remember what she had done, but also tearfully said she had been upset because the childrens mother had recently humiliated her in public.

title: No Heads Rolled at the White House on Friday. But Anxiety Abounds.
description: WASHINGTON  No one was fired at the White House on Friday.

title: And Now, the Nancy Pelosi Drama
description: So, what about Nancy Pelosi?

title: Corrections: March 17, 2018
description: NATIONAL

title: Engineer of Florida Bridge Reported Cracks Days Before Collapse
description: MIAMI  An engineer reported cracks on a newly installed pedestrian bridge two days before it collapsed on a busy roadway here, killing at least six people, state officials said on Friday.

title: The Turnover at the Top of the Trump Administration
description: Since President Trumps inauguration, White House staffers and cabinet officials have left in firings and resignations, one after the other.

title: The Rise of Euro-Putinism
description: There arent many certainties in politics, but heres one: Vladimir Putin will be re-elected to a fourth presidential term in Sundays sham ballot. The larger question is what other elections can Putin win in the coming years.

title: Women Arrested After Trespassing at Arizona Mosque and Mocking Islam
description: Two women were arrested on Thursday after they recorded a video while taking things from a mosque in Arizona and insulting Islam, which the police said might be considered hate speech.

title: Trumps Lawyers Claim Stormy Daniels Violated Confidentiality Agreement at Least 20 Times
description: President Trump, weighing in directly on the Stephanie Clifford case for the first time, claimed in court papers filed by his lawyers on Friday that the porn actress who alleges she had an affair with him violated a confidentiality agreement at least 20 times, exposing her to damages of at least $20 million.

title: Epitome of Completeness
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Roland Huget is back, with another beautifully constructed, super symmetrical puzzle  so called because its symmetrical about the horizontal, vertical and diagonal axes. In other words, you can turn this grid on all four sides and see the same configuration. Accomplishing this involved four 15-letter entries  two across and two down  no mean feat for Mr. Huget, but really mean for us solvers.

title: Andrew McCabe, a Target of Trumps F.B.I. Scorn, Is Fired Over Candor Questions
description: WASHINGTON  Andrew G. McCabe, the former F.B.I. deputy director and a frequent target of President Trumps scorn, was fired Friday after Attorney General Jeff Sessions rejected an appeal that would have let him retire this weekend.

title: Xi Starts New Term in China, With Trusted Deputy to Deal With Trump
description: BEIJING  Xi Jinping started his second term as Chinas president on Saturday, flanked by a new vice president, Wang Qishan, who even without any other titles to his name is shaping up as a potent deputy to Mr. Xi, with a potentially powerful say in grappling with the Trump administration over trade disputes.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Sex & Love Around the World and The Beguiled
description: Christiane Amanpour identifies universal aspects of relationships in a new series. And the lustful melodrama The Beguiled arrives on HBO.

title: Virginia Loses in a Way No One Will Ever Forget
description: Virginias 74-54 defeat at the hands of the University of Maryland, Baltimore County, was a long time coming.

title: U.K., Land of Brexit, Quietly Outsources Some Surgeries to France
description: CALAIS, France  Serge Orlov, a 62-year-old Briton, likes to rail against what he calls the tyranny of the European Union. Like most supporters of his countrys withdrawal from the bloc, he wants Britain to strike out on its own, a fully sovereign state unshackled from Europes pettifogging rules and the Continents overweening state.

title: Saudi Arabia Lightens Up, Building Entertainment Industry From Scratch
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia  The lights dimmed, the conductor emerged and the nearly full house applauded as he stood before the orchestra. Then the lights went up and the cast appeared on stage in historical Arab garb.

title: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads
description: It was another full news week, complete with youth protests across the country, a starry goodbye and more change at the White House. You only have two eyes, so here are some of the top reads of the week you may have missed.

title: A Restaurant That Marries Seattle Ingredients to Southern Cuisine
description: Who would have guessed that the hottest new Southern restaurant in the country is in a quiet residential neighborhood in Seattle? Or that it would score a James Beard award nomination for best new restaurant and that its fried chicken would sell out by 6 p.m. on Sundays?

title: Catharine MacKinnon and Gretchen Carlson Have a Few Things to Say
description: Sexual harassment was not considered anything you could do something about  that the law could help you do something about  until a book was written by a then-young woman named Kitty MacKinnon, the Supreme Court justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg said at the Sundance Film Festival in January. She was there to attend the premiere of the documentary RBG, which will be released this spring. And the book, Sexual Harassment of Working Women, published in 1979, argued that sexual harassment in the workplace is sex discrimination and prohibited by equal protection laws.

title: Scott Pruitt, Trumps Rule-Cutting E.P.A. Chief, Plots His Political Future
description: WASHINGTON  The headline speakers at the Conservative Political Action Conferences annual showcase, the Ronald Reagan Dinner, have historically been rising stars in the Republican Party  firebrand pundits, prominent activists, future presidential candidates.

title: Federal Agency Courted Alcohol Industry to Fund Study on Benefits of Moderate Drinking
description: [Update, June 15: The National Institutes of Health will shut down the study of alcohols effects.]

title: A Santa Barbara Hotel With Ocean Views and Artful Cuisine
description: From $360

title: The World Is Changing. This Trappist Abbey Isnt. Can It Last?
description: MONCKS CORNER, S.C.  A year and a half ago, I could do anything  run the chain saw, cut up trees, use a backhoe.

title: Russia Expels 23 British Diplomats, Escalating Row Over Ex-Spys Poisoning
description: MOSCOW  Russia on Saturday ordered 23 British diplomats to leave the country within a week, escalating a diplomatic crisis after a former Russian spy and his daughter were poisoned with a military grade nerve agent on British soil.

title: An Assassins Tool Kit: When Guns Are Not Enough
description: In the ruthless worlds of espionage, global politics and the criminal underground, there are many grim ways to die:

title: These Days I Miss John Updike, a Remote and Noble Male Mentor
description: Over 20 years ago, in the fall of 1997, I got my first job, at The New Yorker magazine. A small-town girl from coastal Maine, I had graduated from Brown six months earlier and had been recommended by the writer Francine Du Plessix Gray, a visiting professor there. I had taken the bus to New York City, with two pairs of nylons and two wool J. Crew suits packed into a small suitcase  one black, one a pale, beige-y blush  for my interview.

title: Kim Petras Just Wants to Be a Pop Star
description: Kim Petrass debut music video, I Dont Want It at All, dives deep into the heart of teenage girl greed. Set in a fantasy world of Los Angeles boudoirs and boutiques, the clip finds the singer on a frenzied shopping spree, outfitted in what she calls my bitchiest clothes, some of which make her look like a walking wad of bubble gum.

title: This Preacher Would Be Happy to Share Your Bowl of Aa
description: LOS ANGELES  On a strip of Wilshire Boulevard, not far from where the rapper Notorious B.I.G. was gunned down in a drive-by shooting some 20 years ago, a black plastic pool had been placed on the sidewalk outside the El Rey Theater. It was a balmy December afternoon, and the theater had been transformed into an assembly for Zoe Church, a two-and-a-half-year-old evangelical congregation that got its start in a nightclub on Sunset Boulevard.

title: Listen to Dear Sugars: When Sexual Consent Is Neither Black nor White
description: Some sexual encounters are obviously consensual, while others are obviously not. But what about those that are neither black nor white? In the second episode in our series on sexual consent, the Sugars plunge deeper into the gray area.

title: Listen to Dear Sugars: Consent, Part 2
description: How do you account for a crime that isnt legally a crime?

title: The Future of Time Warner, Coming Soon to a Court Near You
description: Beginning next week, AT&T and the Justice Department will lock horns in court to determine if the telecommunications giant will be allowed to absorb the entertainment powerhouse Time Warner.

title: Transgender Volleyball Star in Brazil Eyes Olympics and Stirs Debate
description: SO CAETANO DO SUL, Brazil  When Tifanny Abreu slammed the volleyball over the net, her frizzy ponytail flying behind her, most spectators at a recent game moaned out loud: another point for the visitors.

title: Indian Childrens Book Lists Hitler as Leader Who Will Inspire You
description: NEW DELHI  An Indian publisher came under fire this week for including Hitler in a childrens book about world leaders who have devoted their lives for the betterment of their country and people.

title: Stanford History Event Was Too White and Too Male, Organizer Admits
description: The faces of 30 white men, all speakers at an applied history conference this month at Stanford University, certainly grabbed attention as the images circulated widely last week.

title: Grab a Pillow: Weekend Reads From Opinion
description: The news cycle can leave you dizzy these days, so we wanted to draw your attention to some of the most thought-provoking or amusing reads you might have missed.

title: Alaska Airlines Pilot, Saying She Was Raped by Fellow Pilot, Sues Company
description: An Alaska Airlines pilot has sued the airline, alleging she was drugged and raped by another pilot during a layover last year.

title: At Least 16 Migrants Drown Off Greek Island, Including 5 Children
description: ATHENS  The bodies of 16 people, including at least five children, were recovered from the sea off a Greek island on Saturday after a boat smuggling migrants sank in the eastern Aegean, a spokeswoman for the Greek coast guard said.

title: Unreliable Witnesses to Their Own Meeting?
description: Ashley Denise Hamilton and Jordan Douglas Chisolm were married March 17 at the Biltmore Hotel in Coral Gables, Fla. Pastor Diego Caldern, who was ordained by the Southwinds Christian Church of Miami, officiated.

title: How Trump Consultants Exploited the Facebook Data of Millions
description: (After this story was published, Facebook came under harsh criticism from lawmakers in the United States and Britain. Read the latest.)

title: North Koreas Most Powerful Missile Now Has Its Own Shrine
description: The sleuths suspected that the satellite images showed the launching site of North Koreas most powerful missile, but they were baffled by a mysterious bustle of construction there.

title: New Sinn Fein Leader Has a Familiar Task: Wooing Irish-Americans
description: Every St. Patricks Day for two decades, Gerry Adams or other leaders of Sinn Fein, the party once known primarily as the political arm of the Irish Republican Army, have come to the United States to lobby Washington politicians and rally Irish-American donors.

title: On the Road in Syria, Where Covering the War Is a Paper Chase
description: AINISSA, Syria  On a recent reporting trip the photographer Mauricio Lima and I, along with our driver and a Syrian fixer, came to this town in the middle of nowhere in northern Syria because it is the location of the media office and headquarters of the Syrian Democratic Forces, the coalition of militias dominated by the Kurds and aligned with the American-led international coalition. We were required to report there for yet another piece of paper, having already accumulated a hefty sheaf after some eight hours of road travel over two days.

title: When the Partys Over, but the Beer Cans Remain
description: Q. My condo in Murray Hill overlooks the patio of an apartment in a rental building across the street. The residents of that apartment throw fraternity-style parties that include beer pong. I dont really mind the parties, but I do mind the hundreds of beer cans and plastic cups strewn all over their balcony, which create quite a mess and are an eyesore. They leave the mess there for weeks at a time. Does this run afoul of any New York City laws since the mess is on their balcony?

title: President of Steven Cohens Investment Firm Quits Amid Gender Bias Lawsuit
description: A top executive at the investment firm led by the billionaire investor Steven A. Cohen has stepped down a month after a female employee sued the firm over accusations that it underpaid female employees and fostered a hostile work environment.

title: In Israels Poorer Periphery, Legal Woes Dont Dent Netanyahus Appeal
description: KIRYAT MALACHI, Israel  In the more liberal bastions of Tel Aviv and its well-to-do suburbs, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahus critics tut-tut with each new revelation in the intensifying bribery cases against him, condemning his attacks on the police and eagerly anticipating his political downfall with each former aide who turns states witness.

title: Daria Kasatkina and Naomi Osaka Represent a New Wave
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  The lighthearted tweener tutorial is over. That was last week. Now it is on to much weightier tennis matters for Daria Kasatkina and Naomi Osaka when they next share a court.

title: Our 10 Most Popular Recipes Right Now
description: From chicken Marengo (above) to red beans and rice, here are the recipes readers loved most this week.

title: Man Behind U.M.B.C. Twitter Account Also Takes a Victory Lap
description: Sure, the mens basketball team from the University of Maryland, Baltimore County, pulled off one of the greatest  the greatest?  victories in college sports history late Friday night, toppling Virginia, the N.C.A.A. tournaments No. 1 overall seed.

title: Florida at 200 M.P.H.
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  You wouldnt peg me as an IndyCar fan. Im a bookish, nervous woman staring down midlife, someone who likes to be quiet and who tries hard not to go out in the sun. I hate driving fast, I loathe aggressive drivers, and I have experienced a number of serious anxiety attacks when trying to navigate crowded interstates at high speeds.

title: In Praise of A.D.H.D.
description: Ten years ago, when my son Nicolai was 11, his doctor wanted to put him on medication for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. It would make him less wild, I explained to my mother, who was then 85. It would slow him down a bit.

title: Bridge Collapse Saps Spirits and Research Efforts at Florida International University
description: MIAMI  Florida International University, long known as a commuter school and an engine of mobility for Greater Miamis Cuban-Americans, has in the past two decades transformed itself into one of the largest public universities in the country.

title: Trump Lawyer Says Special Counsel Inquiry Should Be Ended
description: WASHINGTON  A lawyer for President Trump called on the Justice Department on Saturday to end the special counsel investigation into ties between Russia and the Trump campaign, shifting abruptly to a more adversarial stance as the inquiry appeared to be intensifying.

title: Crack on Florida Bridge Was Discussed in Meeting Hours Before Collapse
description: MIAMI  Hours before the collapse of a pedestrian bridge at Florida International University on Thursday, the engineering company for the bridge held a meeting to discuss a crack on the structure, according to a statement from the university released early Saturday.

title: Who Owns the Vikings? Pagans, Neo-Nazis and Advertisers Tussle Over Symbols
description: RUNTUNA, Sweden  The cries of Hell! Hell! ringing out across a snow-clad landscape attracted a curious crowd of weekend tobogganers. At the foot of an ancient Viking burial mound, one of the prime sledding spots near the Swedish village of Runtuna, a circular gathering of pagan worshipers was completing a sacrificial ceremony.

title: Pope Francis Makes Pilgrimage to Honor a Rock-Star Saint
description: SAN GIOVANNI ROTONDO, Italy  Pope Francis made his first visit on Sunday to the shrine of Padre Pio, one of Catholicisms most popular saints, with rock-star standing among the faithful, who believe he bore the stigmata, the wounds of Christs crucifixion.

title: Smuggling of U.S. Technology Is Outpacing Cold War Levels, Experts Say
description: WASHINGTON  Foreign smugglers are trying to ship advanced American technologies  which can be used for weapons and spy equipment  to China, Russia and other adversaries at rates that outpace shadowy and illegal exports during the Cold War, according to United States officials and experts.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  I found todays acrostic challenging, both in its cluing and the vocabulary in the actual grid. This is fitting, though, because Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon have dipped into an apropos subject with todays acrostic: language standards, and who gets to dictate how we say what we say.

title: Shelters Have Saved Countless Afghan Women. So Why Are They Afraid?
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Afghan government is seeking to take financial control of independently run shelters for abused women, alarming aid workers who fear the move could bring the shelters under the sway of conservative figures who have condemned them.

title: Oakland Embraces Marijuana Sales. Compton Bans Them. How Is Justice Best Served?
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  When officers burst into Rickey McCulloughs two-story home in Oakland a decade ago they noted a strong fresh odor of marijuana. Mr. McCullough had been growing large amounts of marijuana illegally, the police said. He was arrested and spent a month in jail.

title: Trump and the Truth: A President Tests His Own Credibility
description: WASHINGTON  When President Trump told donors at a fund-raiser this past week that he had invented a fact during a conversation with Canadas prime minister, the surprise was not that Americas leader makes things up, but that he openly admitted it.

title: A World Series Embrace Was Only One Stop on a Shared Journey
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.  As Brian McCann squatted behind home plate in November at Dodger Stadium, waiting for Corey Seager to get set in the batters box, he looked out at pitcher Charlie Morton and had a moment.

title: Andrew McCabe, Fired F.B.I. Deputy, Is Said to Have Kept Memos on Trump
description: WASHINGTON  Andrew G. McCabe, the former deputy F.B.I. director who was fired late Friday, kept contemporaneous memos about his interactions with President Trump and his conversations with the former director James B. Comey, a person close to Mr. McCabe said on Saturday.

title: Trump, Flush With Power
description: WASHINGTON  This was the week Donald Trump became president.

title: Anti-Semitism Is Rising. Why Arent American Jews Speaking Up?
description: Anti-Semitic hate crimes are on the rise, up 57 percent in 2017 from 2016, the largest single-year jump on record, according to the Anti-Defamation League. That increase came on top of the rise in incidents in 2016 that coincided with a brutal presidential campaign.

title: The Poison Putin Spreads
description: BEIJING  He has stifled his political opponents and enriched friends and cronies. He annexed a chunk of Ukraine, threw moral and military support to Syrias dictator in a brutal civil war and tried to tip the scales in an American presidential election. For the second time in barely a decade, he stands accused of orchestrating the exotic poisoning of an exiled former intelligence operative in Britain.

title: Do Not Read This Editorial While Walking
description: Should you be reading this on some electronic device while crossing the street, please stop. Right now. Traffic may be swirling around you. Your inattentiveness puts you in harms way. And if by chance youre in Montclair, Calif., while reading this and crossing the street, youd best keep an eye out not only for cars but also for the police. Youre breaking the law.

title: One Mans Self-Imposed News Blockade
description: To the Editor:

title: A Parable of Self-Destruction
description: EASTER ISLAND  This remote speck in the South Pacific is famous for its colossal stone statues, nearly 1,000 of them towering over the landscape like guardians.

title: The Case for a Carbon Tax on Beef
description: Let me admit up front that I would rather be eating a cheeseburger right now. Or maybe trying out a promising new recipe for Korean braised short ribs. But our collective love affair with beef, dating back more than 10,000 years, has gone wrong, in so many ways. And in my head, if not in my appetites, I know its time to break it off.

title: What the Dreamers Can Teach the Parkland Kids
description: It was Jan. 1, 2010, the beginning of a new decade. Instead of sleeping in after what should have been a fun night bringing in the new year, my friends and I were up early putting on matching Nike sneakers to start walking the 1,500 miles from Miami to Washington.

title: Kris Kobachs Voting Sham Gets Exposed in Court
description: This is part of a series on voting in America, which will run up to Election Day in November. For Part 1, on the importance of voting, go here. And for Part 3, on the Supreme Court and racially discriminatory voting laws, go here.

title: Chris Hayes: What Law and Order Means to Trump
description: Donald Trump is not subtle. While normal political language functions through implication and indirection, Mr. Trump luxuriates in saying the quiet part loud. But in doing so, Mr. Trump exposes what drives the politics of the movement he commands. That is most evident in the way he talks about crime and punishment.

title: Dont Run From Trump
description: HOUSTON  Im here to tell my fellow Republicans, in particular Republican members of Congress and the Republican consulting class: You can run, but you cant hide.

title: Its Hard to Be Hungry on Spring Break
description: The phrase spring break conjures up images of college students lounging on beaches by day and hitting the clubs at night. Many students do, in fact, travel from campus to far-flung places. On the assumption that most students leave, schools generally shut down. But this assumption is outdated, especially as colleges enroll a greater number of academically talented students from poor families.

title: Democrats Are Primed for 2018 and Looking Pretty in 2020
description: Throughout the 2016 election cycle and ever since, Ive been hearing that the Democratic Party has no bench. This is 100 percent true. When it comes to credible presidential prospects, the Democratic Party has several rows of benches. The Democratic Party has bleachers.

title: N.C.A.A. Mens Tournament: Another Upset for Loyola-Chicago
description: Clayton Custers jumper glanced off the front of the rim, floated up high to kiss the backboard and then seemed to hang in the air forever.

title: Daily Affirmations From the White House
description: The world is a difficult place right now. And tough times call for serious self-care. Some people need 10 minutes with a kind-of-creepy-but-ultimately-relaxing sheet mask on their face to feel calm  and for dewy skin. Some people need pints of cookie dough ice cream and to hide their phones in the freezer.

title: Mueller Wants Trumps Business Records. Whats the Russia Connection?
description: The investigation into Russian meddling in the 2016 election has expanded to include President Trumps family business, with the special counsel, Robert S. Mueller III, subpoenaing the Trump Organization for documents related to Russia.

title: North Korea-Sweden Talks Focus on Peaceful Solution to Nuclear Conflict
description: The Swedish and North Korean foreign ministers concluded three days of talks in Stockholm on Saturday over the security situation on the Korean Peninsula, discussions that may help facilitate a meeting between President Donald Trump and Kim Jong-un, the leader of North Korea.

title: Slovakia Erupts After Journalists Murder
description: Huge demonstrations in Slovakia, the largest in Central Europe since the fall of communism, followed the murder of an investigative journalist and led to the resignation of the prime minister.

title: Young Slovaks Buck a Trend, Protesting to Save Their Democracy
description: BRATISLAVA, Slovakia  Born in 1990, Zuzana Hlavkova never knew the struggles of her parents generation who lived under Communism. Nor of the generation before that, witness to a world gone mad during World War II.

title: Russias Election: More Charade Than Race
description: President Vladimir Putins real challenge in Sundays presidential election is not winning the race, but getting enough turnout to show the world his victory is legitimate.

title: Cinderella Story? Its True for U.M.B.C. in Academics, Too
description: BALTIMORE  The stunning victory by the University of Maryland, Baltimore County, over the University of Virginia on Friday night  the biggest upset ever in the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament  catapulted a school whose competitive claim to fame had long been chess into sports history.

title: 32 Teams, 7 Days, 1 Gym
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  One by one, the teams marched onto the court, lining up in rows until they had filled half the floor from baseline to midcourt, roughly 500 mens college basketball players, coaches and team managers standing shoulder to shoulder.

title: A Little-Known University Stuns No. 1 Virginia? You Must Mean Chaminade
description: On Thursday night in Honolulu, less than 24 hours before the biggest upset in the history of the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament took place, across half an ocean and a full continent, Chaminade University held its annual athletics gala.

title: Taking Your Q
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Daniel Raymon brings us a sunny, bright Sunday puzzle today, one that didnt vex me much but was still satisfying. If you had a long week, think of this grid as an excuse to lighten up a little bit.

title: Data Firm Tied to Trump Campaign Talked Business With Russians
description: When the Russia question came up during a hearing at the British Parliament last month, Alexander Nix did not hesitate.

title: Quotation of the Day: A Star Athlete, Her Eyes on the Olympics and History, Stirs Up Brazil
description: I love volleyball, but it is just my job. The day Im no longer working, Ill still be happy because I am me, Tifanny, the person I always imagined.

title: Adrin Lamo, Hacker Who Reported Chelsea Manning to the F.B.I., Dies at 37
description: Adrin Lamo, a hacker best known for breaking into the computer networks of The New York Times and other major corporations, and for reporting the Army whistle-blower Chelsea Manning to the authorities, was found dead on Wednesday in Wichita, Kan. He was 37.

title: After Historic Victory, U.M.B.C. Students Look Forward to the Next  Lab
description: BALTIMORE  Scenes from the University of Maryland, Baltimore County, campus, roughly 16 hours after its Retrievers pulled off the college basketball equivalent of the moon landing:

title: AIDS Researcher Top Candidate to Lead the C.D.C.
description: One of the nations leading AIDS researchers and an expert in the treatment of heroin addiction is the leading candidate to oversee the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

title: Embracing China, Facebook and Himself, Cambodias Ruler Digs In
description: STUNG TRANG, Cambodia  As the sun rose over the murk of the Mekong River, the man who has ruled Cambodia for more than three decades, Prime Minister Hun Sen, clasped hands with the Chinese ambassador and beamed.

title: Corrections: March 18, 2018
description: SUNDAY STYLES

title: The two meanings of cleave
description: The two meanings of cleave

title: Sharisse Kimbro, Clemont Austin IV
description: Sharisse Edwards Kimbro and Clemont Robert Austin IV were married March 17 at Merry-Go-Round rock, an outdoor wedding venue in Sedona, Ariz. The Rev. Dr. Brenda Salter McNeil, who was ordained by the Evangelical Covenant Church, officiated.

title: Caroline Reuss, Michael Simonelli
description: Caroline Hughes Reuss and Michael Richard Simonelli were married March 17 at the Sacred Heart Church in Lake George, N.Y. The Rev. Guy A. Childs, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Tracey Auster, Jeffrey Grimes
description: Tracey Lauren Auster and Jeffrey Scott Grimes were married March 17 at the Tarrytown House Estate on the Hudson in Tarrytown, N.Y. Rabbi Jennifer Jaech officiated.

title: Kathryn Soul, Kellan Hetrick
description: Kathryn Beck Soul and Kellan Blair Hetrick were married March 17 at the Tidewater Inn in Easton, Md. Erik Stier, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Melissa Phillips, Benjamin Cary
description: Melissa Renee Phillips and Benjamin Rush Cary were married March 17 in New York. The Rev. Dr. Charles M. Cary, a Presbyterian minister and the grooms father, performed the ceremony at the Brick Presbyterian Church.

title: Annemarie Hillman, Douglas Rosenthal
description: Annemarie Lehrmann Hillman and Douglas Joseph Rosenthal were married March 17 at the District Winery in Washington. Judge Amit P. Mehta of the United States District Court for the District of Columbia, for whom the bride served as a law clerk, officiated.

title: Weijia Jiang, Luther Lowe
description: Weijia Jiang and Travis Luther Lowe were married March 17 at Casa de Monte Vista, an events space in Palm Springs, Calif. Jim Obergefell, who became a deputy commissioner for marriage in Riverside County, Calif., for the occasion, led a ceremony incorporating a Chinese tea ceremony.

title: Simran Winkelstern, Moses Kagan
description: Simran Rebecca Winkelstern and Moses Jonathan Kagan were married March 16 at the Beverly Hills Courthouse in Beverly Hills, Calif. Bruce Weinberg, a deputy commissioner of civil marriage for Los Angeles County, officiated.

title: Michelle Torbeck, Mark Berlacher
description: Dr. Michelle Ariana Torbeck and Dr. Mark Douglas Berlacher were married March 17 at St. Francis de Sales Church in Cincinnati. The Rev. Alan Zobler, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Benjamin Toff, Andrew Tangel
description: Benjamin Toff and Andrew Tangel were married March 17 at the Arizona-Sonora Desert Museum in Tucson. Bruce Cohen, a Maricopa County Superior Court Judge with chambers in Phoenix, officiated.

title: Katherine Haves, Gabriel Malitzky
description: Katherine Alexandra Haves and Gabriel Sy Malitzky are to be married March 18 at the Rainbow Room in Manhattan. Rabbi Amy B. Ehrlich is to officiate.

title: John-Carlos Estrada, Bruce Tharp
description: John-Carlos Estrada and Dr. D. Bruce Tharp were married March 17. Veronica Estrada, Mr. Estradas sister, who was ordained through American Marriage Ministries, officiated at the Texas Discovery Gardens at Fair Park in Dallas.

title: Molly Cohen, Daniel Miller
description: Molly Hara Cohen and Daniel Eric Miller were married March 17 by Rabbi Shoshana Mitrani Knapp at TriBeCa 360, an events space in New York.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Instinct and Brooklyn Nine-Nine
description: Alan Cumming leads a new drama on CBS. And Brooklyn Nine-Nine returns.

title: Memo to Theresa May: In Premier League, Russian Roots Run Deep
description: LONDON  The Russian flag has been there so long now that it hardly attracts any notice, just another familiar piece of background scenery in the global, cosmopolitan Premier League.

title: Freshmans Desperate Shot Saves Michigan at the Buzzer
description: WICHITA, Kan.  They call the play Tennessee, Isaiah Livers said, or maybe Indiana. Or possibly Texas, he was not exactly sure.

title: S.N.L. Takes Aim at Betsy DeVos, Jeff Sessions and Rex Tillerson
description: As you would expect for an episode of Saturday Night Live hosted by Bill Hader, the former S.N.L. cast member, this one had everything: new installments of long-running sketches like The Californians; cameos from Fred Armisen and John Goodman; and an appearance by Haders eccentric night-life correspondent, Stefon, who helpfully explained what Farrah-chauns are. (Those are leprechauns that look like Farrah Fawcett, obviously.)

title: Putin Wins Russia Election, and Broad Mandate for 4th Term
description: MOSCOW  Russian voters gave President Vladimir V. Putin resounding approval for a fourth term on Sunday, with nearly complete figures from the Central Election Commission showing him winning more than three-quarters of the vote with a turnout of more than 67 percent.

title: An Inspection Blitz Targeted Offshore Cranes in the Gulf of Mexico
description: The Interior Department sent out dozens of inspectors this month to search for hazards related to cranes used with oil and gas platforms and drilling rigs. Lifting equipment is the second-leading cause of death among offshore workers.

title: Nancy Pelosi Wants to Lead. House Democratic Candidates Arent So Sure.
description: WASHINGTON  A few hours after Conor Lamb, the Pennsylvania Democrat, claimed victory in a House race with a vow to oppose his partys leader, Nancy Pelosi, the once-and-perhaps-future speaker was explaining to a group of female congressional candidates why she did not retire after 2016.

title: Offshore Oil and Gas Operators Want Less Regulation, but Surprise Inspections Find Serious Safety Problems
description: Faced with questions about its commitment to safety, the Interior Department sent teams to the Gulf of Mexico last week to inspect giant cranes used in offshore oil and gas operations that are a significant source of accidents.

title: Homes That Sold for $430,000 or Less
description: 424 Fairview Avenue, Cedar Grove

title: A Wrestling Culture That Helps Keep Boys Away From Fighting
description: MAKHACHKALA, Russia  Dagestan, a mostly Muslim region in the south of Russia on the northwest coast of the Caspian Sea, is known for the stark beauty of its mountain landscapes, for its many small ethnic groups, for a violent and long-simmering Islamist insurgency  and for its wrestlers.

title: Cambridge Analytica, McCabe, F.I.U.: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Britain Says It Has Proof Russia Stockpiled Lethal Nerve Agent
description: LONDON  Britain has evidence that Russia has been manufacturing and stockpiling the nerve agent used in an attack on a former Russian double agent on British soil, the British foreign secretary, Boris Johnson, said on Sunday.

title: China to Name New Central Bank Chief as It Seeks Continuity Amid Change
description: China plans to name a new leader for its central bank on Monday in a move signaling that Beijing will continue an ambitious  and, some say, much needed  financial shake-up to get the countrys debt under control and keep its economy growing.

title: Trump Assails Mueller, Drawing Rebukes From Republicans
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump on Sunday abandoned a strategy of showing deference to the special counsel examining Russias interference in the 2016 presidential election, lashing out at what he characterized as a partisan investigation and alarming Republicans who feared he might seek to shut it down.

title: Masterpiece Rental: My Life in the American Gothic House
description: Grant Woods American Gothic painting (and all of its parodies) may be legendary, but most people dont realize that the little white farmhouse in the background is real  that its located in Eldon, Iowa (pop. 900), that its owned by the State Historical Society, and that, until recently, it was a private residence. There are only a handful of people who can say theyve lived inside his masterpiece painting.

title: Syrian Rebels, Backed by Turkey, Seize Control of Afrin
description: GAZIANTEP, Turkey  Turkish-backed Syrian rebels seized control on Sunday morning of the city of Afrin, the target of a two-month military operation against Kurdish militias in the enclave in Syria. The takeover dealt a blow to Kurdish aspirations for self-administration there and added to Turkeys growing footprint in the country.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. Its always darkest before the dawn, et cetera, but I am sick of winter and really dont want to cook any more root vegetables this week. I want to toss fiddleheads in foaming butter, roast asparagus over an open fire, mess with new radishes, plop a bunch of crunchy watercress down next to a modest steak, then go look for warblers returning north from their winter breaks down south.

title: U.K. Lawmakers Say Britain Should Consider Delaying Brexit
description: LONDON  Britain should seek to postpone its exit from the European Union if talks drag on during the next few months, an influential committee of lawmakers concluded on Sunday.

title: Killed, Shovel in Hand: Afghan Farmers Are Latest Victims of a Chaotic War
description: CHAPARHAR, Afghanistan  There was no military curfew in the villages, but, as a precaution, the farmers still informed the local police outpost that they would be in their fields before dawn, with lanterns and shovels, to channel water to their crops.

title: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: A Missionarys Daughter in Haiti
description: My father has never known how to be gentle with those who do not live up to his expectations, Apricot Irving writes in her new memoir, The Gospel of Trees. Ms. Irving spent part of her childhood in Haiti, where her father, an agronomist, was a missionary. He believed strongly, often stubbornly, in the benefits of reforestation in the country. Against the backdrop of Haitis natural beauty, Ms. Irving witnessed political turmoil and lived through her familys own strife. Below, she discusses how time in Indonesia helped her decide to tell this story, feeling like a reluctant memoirist and more.

title: Skinhead Lesbian Tweet About Parkland Student Ends Maine Republicans Candidacy
description: A Republican candidate for the Maine State House who disparaged two teenage survivors of the school shooting in Parkland, Fla., dropped out of the race after drawing heavy criticism and challengers from both political parties.

title: Is Richard Carranza Ready to Run Americas Biggest School System?
description: If the New York City school system, with its 1.1 million students, were its own metropolis, it would be the 10th largest in the country, bigger than Austin, Indianapolis or San Francisco. And starting next month, there will be a new mayor in town.

title: Air France Reminds Travelers What Their Flight Could Be Like
description: You open what looks like an in-flight care package to find 50 feet of Sudoku puzzles on a roll, Champagne-flavored gummy candies and a scratch-and-sniff patch that smells like boeuf bourguignon. In a time of low-cost airlines, where your ticket might not include a hot meal or free access to electronic entertainment, the box reminds you of what could be if you shell out a little more on Air France.

title: Boko Harams Seizure of 110 Girls Taunts Nigeria, and Its Leader
description: DAPCHI, Nigeria  When he heard the gunfire, the guard ran outside the all-girls boarding school and saw camouflaged vehicles barreling toward the gate. Thinking they were Nigerian military troops, he rushed toward them.

title: Roots Show at SXSW in Austin Is Canceled After Bomb Threat
description: A bomb threat in Austin, Tex., led to an arrest and the cancellation of a Roots concert at the South by Southwest festival.

title: Testilying by Police: A Stubborn Problem
description: Officer Nector Martinez took the witness stand in a Bronx courtroom on Oct. 10, 2017, and swore to tell the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth, so help him God.

title: Tomb Raider Cant Topple Black Panther at Box Office
description: The return of a blockbuster action franchise couldnt bump Black Panther from the top of the box office this week. The Marvel movie earned another $27 million for its fifth straight week at No. 1, leaving Tomb Raider to settle for second place.

title: The Trust Equation: Wealth and Power Equals Misery
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif.  Money. Sex. Violence. Kidnapping.

title: Ubers New Rival in Australia: An Indian Upstart
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Ola built itself into Indias leading ride-hailing company by catering to the particular needs of Indian customers, who often like to settle fares in cash and jump on cheap, three-wheeled auto-rickshaws for short trips.

title: Meet FedExs New Team of Robots
description: Jefe is a member of FedExs new fleet of autonomous robots, purchased to transport large and unwieldy packages around one of the companys facilities.

title: FedEx Follows Amazon Into the Robotic Future
description: KERNERSVILLE, N.C.  As soon as the first robot arrived at a FedEx shipping hub in the heart of North Carolina tobacco country early last year, talk of pink slips was in the air.

title: Review: In The Wholehearted, Old Wounds Feel Angry and New
description: On camera, talking about the time her husband tried to kill her, first with a hibachi knife and then with a Glock, Dee Crosby is the picture of professional composure. A boxing champ, she knows her way around an interview.

title: Why Are Black Students Punished So Often? Minnesota Confronts a National Quandary
description: MINNEAPOLIS  When Erin Rathke, the principal at Justice Page Middle School, is called to extract a student from class, she hears the same plea over and over again, most often, she has to admit, from black children: The teacher only sees me.

title: Review: Ligeti Sounded Thrilling, When Alarm Will Sound Was Let Loose
description: I was a skeptic regarding concerts that try to pull double duty as podcasts. But Fridays show by Alarm Will Sound at Zankel Hall converted me to the explainer-format gig  at least partially.

title: Austrias Far Right Wants the Freedom to Smoke
description: VIENNA  Three winters ago, during a highly public fight against lung cancer, Kurt Kuch, a smoker and prominent journalist in Austria, threw his popularity behind a Dont Smoke campaign, hoping to spare others his fate.

title: Live in the Subway: Maybe the Best Beatles Cover Band Ever
description: A tide of commuters came and went as a Brooklyn-bound F train stopped at the 14th Street station in Manhattan, and a smattering of others milled around the platform, staring at their phones or nothing at all as they waited. None of them paid any attention as Rahiem Taylor strummed his bass guitar and his twin brother, Amiri, tried to reattach the strap to his acoustic guitar.

title: Russia, North Korea, Xi Jinping: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Take This App and Call Me in the Morning
description: Health tech companies are making a big push to digitize medicine, introducing novel tools like digital pills that track when patients take their drugs and smart spoons that can automatically adjust to hand tremors.

title: Facebooks Role in Data Misuse Sets Off Storms on Two Continents
description: WASHINGTON  Facebook on Sunday faced a backlash about how it protects user data, as American and British lawmakers demanded that it explain how a political data firm with links to President Trumps 2016 campaign was able to harvest private information from more than 50 million Facebook profiles without the social networks alerting users.

title: An Offer Trump Couldnt Resist
description: Officials are negotiating the details of a face-to-face meeting between President Trump and leader Kim Jong-un of North Korea. Mr. Trump turned the heads of even his own advisers earlier this month when he spontaneously agreed to sit down and hash out relations with Mr. Kim. A place and date have yet to be determined.

title: N.C.A.A. Mens Tournament: No. 1 Xavier Falls in Night of Upsets
description: Florida States players were so jubilant they didnt quite know where to go, so they ran up into the stands to shake hands with whomever they might find. The program had never beaten a No. 1 seed in the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament before.

title: Buoyed by Financial Support, Military Veterans Are a Growing Part of the Paralympics
description: PYEONGCHANG, South Korea  Rusty Schieber, the United States wheelchair curling coach, has a theory about the future of the American Paralympic movement. It echoes the past.

title: World Upside Down: As Trump Pushes Tariffs, Latin America Links Up
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  Latin American leaders braced for the worst last year as they watched President Trump take office, with his vows to protect Americans from the ravages of other countries making our products, stealing our companies and destroying our jobs.

title: 2 Charter Commissions? Mayor and Council Are Creating Separate Panels
description: It may not have reached the ear-biting level, but a wrestling match between Mayor Bill de Blasio and the City Council over the City Charter is heating up. Council members on Friday took a step toward creating a commission that would propose changes to the charter  hours after the mayor rushed appointments to his own, separate, charter commission.

title: Mortar Shell Kills 5 Members of a Family in Kashmir
description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir  Five members of a family were killed and two others were wounded by shelling in the Indian-controlled portion of Kashmir on Sunday, residents and officials said.

description: To the Editor:
